Hi team, the section options in Confluence are great, but there just aren't enough of them! It would be great to see options involving fourths of the screen added, such as these:

[ 1/4 ] [ 1/4 ] [ 1/4 ] [ 1/4 ]
[ 1/4 ] [ ____ 3/4 _____ ]
[ ____ 3/4 _____ ] [ 1/4 ]
[ 1/4 ] [ __ 1/2 __ ] [ 1/4 ]
[ 1/4 ] [ 1/4 ] [ __ 1/2 __ ]
[ __ 1/2 __ ] [ 1/4 ] [ 1/4 ]

This would really help us to easily format our pages. Thanks for considering it!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35555].
  {panel}

h5.Environment: 
Confluence 5.4.3, Confluence 5.4.4
JIRA 6.3.7

h5.Steps to reproduce
# Create an application link between JIRA and Confluence
# In JIRA, create a scrum project, that has at least one epic in it.
# In Confluence, create a page with the "Page Properties Macro".
# Give this page a label of "Report"
# Insert a table with one row, one heading column and one body column. Set the header to "Epic" and insert a JIRA link to the epic you created.
# Duplicate this page 25-30 times
# Create a new page, and insert the "Page Properties Report" macro
## Enter "report" as the label
## Enter "epic" as a field to be displayed
## Save the report page and refresh

h5.Expected Results
The page should be displayed as quickly since issues from JIRA should be batched (as per https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31899)

Displaying lots of JIRA issues on a page isn't a problem - a dozen or so issues on a single macro, displayed 3-4 times on a single page loads almost instantly.

h5.Actual Results
The page properties report macro can take a noticeably longer period of time to load. The performance problem can be exacerbated by higher usage in a production environment.

h5.Workaround
Remove any fields containing a JIRA macro from the page properties report macro. This will at least return performance to normal.

Additionally, performance appears to be a little better in newer versions of Confluence, but can still be a problem in a loaded production environment.
fields.summary: Poor performance in JIRA isssues macro when used in conjunction with a page properties report

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35553].
  {panel}

When exporting a space (it doesn't matter if it's XML, HTML or PDF exports), after the space export is finished, below the completion bar should have a "here" with a link after the "Download", however it's missing on Internet Explorer 11.
Check screenshot.

*Workaround:*
- Go to {{<Confluence Installation>/confluence/admin/longrunningtask-common.vm}} and find this line 
{{return response.getElementsByTagName(tagName)[0].firstChild.data;}} and replace it with {{return response.getElementsByTagName(tagName)[0].textContent;}}

OR
- Use another browser, since this still works on Firefox, Chrome and Safari.

OR
- Using IE 11 in compatibility mode and change the compatibility mode to IE 9 when exporting the space. The download link will appear if set to IE 9 compatibility mode.

[View this link on how to change the compatibility mode and compatibility version in developer mode|http://kb.mit.edu/confluence/display/istcontrib/How+to+change+your+setting+for+Compatibility+mode+for+Internet+Explorer#HowtochangeyoursettingforCompatibilitymodeforInternetExplorer-UseDeveloperToolstochangeIECompatibilitymodeversion]
fields.summary: Can't download exported space from IE11
Add "Got Feedback?" on Confluence home page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35540].
  {panel}

Reproducible using Chrome 38 and Confluence 5.6.3.

When you use the browser "back" button to return to the Export PDF Options page after doing a custom export of selected pages, it remembers that you had selected "Custom Export" but the page selector is reset to the default of "all pages" and the page selection is not displayed. (see [^back to export pdf options.png]) A user may then click on the Export button, either in an attempt to get the page list to be displayed, or on the assumption that the same page selection will be used as last time. This triggers an accidental full space export which consumes resources needlessly. 

Workaround is to click on Custom Export or change the export type to Normal Export and then back to Custom, so that the page selection is displayed and the user can set the pages to export (again).

Note that the behaviour is different with Firefox 31 ESR. In that case when you go "back" to the Export PDF Options page after doing a custom export of selected pages, *all* selections are reset to initial values. This means that the type is set back to Normal Export. It's not nice that the user's settings have been forgotten, but at least they are all forgotten consistently and it's unlikely that the user will be confused about what will happen when they click Export. 

What would really be nice is if the tool remembered *all* the export settings (export type and selected pages) so that a user could easily redo the same export. One of our users discovered this problem when they did a custom export, checked the results, discovered a problem, fixed it on the Confluence page, and then tried to go "back" to redo the same export.
fields.summary: Export PDF options behaviour can lead to accidentally triggering a full space export
add warning message when switching user directories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35503].
  {panel}

Per https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Space+Blueprint+Module?focusedCommentId=30614152#comment-30614152 , it would be good if a Space BP plugin developer could fix the ordering of the pages that are created in a new Space.

I see two ways that this could be done:

# Add a "position" attribute to each ContentTemplateRef, that is passed to the Page when being added to the database, OR
# Add a "childrenOrdered" flag attribute to the ContentTemplateRef for the childrens' parent page, which would calculate the correct Page position to set for each child being added to the database

The first option is good because it would generically allow content-template plugin modules to indicate their desired position in the page order, and bad for the same reason - it could be used to create pages that push their way to the top of the order, without user consent.

The second option is a little ugly because the positions of the children would be defined via the parent's configuration, yet it would give Confluence's code final say over the actual position used for each child.
fields.summary: Allow child templates in Space Blueprints to have manual ordering

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35488].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When sharing a non-SSL site via share-Blueprint, favicon and images are included as http elements too. That's reasonable but unfortunately totally wrong for Servers who are running SSL.

This will cause
* Security exceptions in Browser
* non-displayed content

depends on your browser.

example: https://wiki.childno.de/x/PQCDAQ
so actually only testing with 5.44 ... will update soon, then I'll give an update if it still happens, but I'll bet it will ;/

h3. Environment
Testing in
* Chrome
* Mozilla

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use a Confluence using HTTPS
# Create a Page in Confluence selecting the 'Share Link' blueprint
# Add a link to a page using HTTP

h3. Expected Results
The page is secure over HTTPS

h3. Actual Results
Some contents, like icons, are displayed as HTTP. Encryption errors are shown, as the page is HTTPS, but some content uses HTTP.
 
h3. Notes
This is related to so many other issues like
[project = CONF AND (text ~ "content" OR text ~ "insecure" OR text ~ "https")|https://jira.atlassian.com/issues/?jql=project%20%3D%20CONF%20AND%20(text%20~%20%22content%22%20OR%20text%20~%20%22insecure%22%20OR%20text%20~%20%22https%22)]
e.g.
* CONF-31901(Widget connector, not fixed)
* CONF-31065 (What's new, fixed in 5.5)
* CONF-31098 (youtube, fixed in 5.3.4)

c'mon ... please check ALL you widgets, crawler, etc.
seems to with 5.5. only a subset has been fixed (What's new).
It's really annoying for most business users!

h3.Workaround
*Partial workaround*
Edit the page and remove the content that is not encrypted (it will be lost)
fields.summary: Mixed Content errors when sharing non-https links via Share Blueprint

We are using Confluence to generate customer facing documentation. User groups have requested me to generate a (monthly) report of all changes in space, one that does not require any extra clicks.

What we need is the style of notification that is sent after a single page modification (changes marked in the message) but then accumulated for all changes in a month. But, if I make a change myself, obviously I do not get a notification for that, so the only way around it would be to create another user and have all notifications sent to a that e-mailadres, and monthly, print out all e-mails.

I have tried the daily digest, but this only shows a page was changed, not what was changed.

I have tried the RSS feed, with the same problem.

I did not find any macro's either that work on space level.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35463].
  {panel}

There is a third party package available to server-based instances but nothing generally available for cloud-based users that I can find. Minimum requirements would be:
1. Ability to assign single to many approvers for a given document
2. Approval requests relayed via email to approvers
3. Ability to configure approval request to run serially (1st approver must approve before 2nd) or in parallel (Approvers can review and approve in any order)
4. Ability to assign a Due Date to approval request
5. Automatic email notification / follow up on approval tasks not completed
6. Email message included with approval request that is configurable 
7. Approval/Rejection can include a comment / note from Assignee
8. Configurable option to end the approval process if it is rejected by any participant
9. Configurable option to end the approval process if the document is changed before the process completes
10. Automatic notification to Creator when approvals have completed or been rejected
11. Document approval history available for x days/years
fields.summary: Robust Workflow process to address need for a Document Approval Tool within Confluence

Both finished and open tasks looks same, they can be distinguised only by the state of their checkboxes. So I propose to put CSS styles for finished tasks and make it by default italic/grey.

There are many other features, that would boost productivity of this feature. For example add labels to each task, filters by tasks, deadlines .. But for now I will be happy with hiding finished tasks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35431].
  {panel}

Confluence database schema does not seem to follow any particular naming convention.

For some databases, such as MySQL, table names can be uppercase or lowercase, depending on the table.

The use of plural is also inconsistent. Some tables are in plural (likes, links,...) but some other are in singular (label).

This will help to be able to provide SQL queries which will work in any Confluence database, independently of the case sensitivity for the database.
fields.summary: Have a consistent naming convention for table names in the database schema

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35412].
  {panel}

When an anchor like is followed, the only indication of where the anchor is located on the page is by the browser attempting to place the anchor at the top of the viewing window. When the page is short or the viewing window is tall/wide, this won't work as the view cannot be scrolled sufficiently low. When there is a high density of anchors or multiple on the same line this may also be ambiguous (although that could be a separate issue).

Some thoughts of how to make them more visible:
- Allow anchors to have contents or provide a mechanism to label page elements
- Have anchors/elements change size/colour when they're the target of browsing (similar to comments)

Motivating reason:
Some of my users are moving documentation to our wiki and trying to use it for drafting papers. They want to have pages that contain lists/details of references and then be able to link to them where appropriate. The current solution is to use anchors, but this isn't as elegant a solution as they'd like.
fields.summary: Improve the visibility of anchors

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35396].
  {panel}

Page move action requires a significant amount of insert/update/delete to the database as moving one page requires updating that page itself and all its descendant pages. This heavy procedure might cause bad user experience as they have to wait a considerable amount of time before their actions are completed. In addition, it's also the root cause of DB deadlock as it locks some tables for a quite long period of time.

Activities that slows down moving pages:
* Select/Update/Insert to CONFANCESTORS table
* Update JOURNALENTRY table
* Update links in moved pages.

Problems found with current implementation:
* CONTENTPROPERTIES is set loaded "eager" causing N+1 problem.
* Updating page's links procedure is called when pages are moved inside the same space (this heavy procedure should be skipped in this case).
* Each getAncestors() call creates one SELECT query to DB.

*Update 17/11/2015*
There is definitely some performance improvement in 5.8.6 (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-35396?focusedCommentId=827923&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-827923) but not the order of magnitude I expected. Reopening issue because of that.
fields.summary: Page move action is too slow when moving a large number of pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35395].
  {panel}

When viewing a Excel document which has a lot of cells, it will cause OOME due to it takes a significant amount of memory to render.

Steps to reproduce:
* Create an excel file.
* Move to the mouse to the last cell (XFD x 1048576)
* Save excel file
* Render this file cause OOME.
fields.summary: Viewing embedded Excel documents can cause Confluence to run out of memory

fields.summary: Show windows popup on dashboard
Improve Label Dialog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35389].
  {panel}

There is already the ability to create tasks from lists in Confluence, but it could also be helpful to be able to do the same with a table.

h3. Current behavior
Currently if you attempt to create a task list from a table it will create a task on the elements in the first row

h3. Preferred behavior
Instead of changing the elements in the first row, add a new column that includes the task checkbox

h3. Related Notes
* See attached image for examples of preferred and current behavior
fields.summary: Add Ability to Create Task Lists From Tables
aui-button-primary buttons should respect system colors
Create Space dialog should work with arrow keys
Able to create unlimited excerpt-macros in a page.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35384].
  {panel}

This is a feature suggestion.

I would like the excerpt macro include settings to have an option to type a text that will link to the original exerpt-macro page.
That way the user read the exerpt and if he wants to read the whole original excerpt page he just have to click on the link below/or-above button/text

Otherwise I have to create the excerpt-include and write myself a text below it "click here for more info" and make it a link to where the exerpt is getting its content.

One problem with this is that I am using Brikit, and this link I have created does not take me to a TAB where this excerpt-macro was located.  It just takes me to the start of that page.  So I have to look to the tab where the excerpt came from.  Therefor I may think that the "link for more info" took me to the wrong content-page.

For example:

My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text
My textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy text
"exerpt text here, exerpt text here, exerpt text here, exerpt text here
exerpt text hereexerpt text hereexerpt text hereexerpt text here"
click here to visit the original exerpt page

My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text, My text
My textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy textMy text


You could have two modes for showing this text-with-link.  One located on the frame of the exerpt.  And one below-end/above-start the exerpt if no frame is used.

You could also have instead of a "text with the link" an option to just use a tiny button ( with the default-text "info" or "?" or "more").
fields.summary: Excerpt Macro show more-info-link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-35382].
  {panel}

We receive this error:
"Lucidchart Macro
The rich viewer is unavailable for this macro. To enable this functionality, you must update the macro to the most recent version of the diagram."

Without being able to access the diagrams from our documents, Confluence is basically unusable for you.

For instance:
https://adswizz.jira.com/wiki/display/INVENTORY/Architecture+-+Final
fields.summary: LucidChart integration no longer works in our Confluence documents
